metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17543 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code is different in bionic and earlier, no indication that it is vulnerable to this issue.

criterions.comment: lz4 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.2-2').
